summary: Worker should log an informational message when initialized with no workflows registered, to help users diagnose configuration issues where they accidentally skip workflow bundle initialization.
userImpact: Users who accidentally skip workflow bundle initialization will see a confusing hung worker instead of a clear message explaining why no work is being polled.
proposedFix: Log at INFO level: 'This worker has no workflows registered and will not poll for workflow tasks!'
resolutionDetails: Implementation added logging in worker initialization to detect activity-only mode
keyQuote: We should log at the `INFO` level something like "This worker has no workflows registered and will not poll for workflow tasks!"
